name: SECTION 3 – PRODUCT DATA SHEETS FOR ENGINEERS APPROVALS
Detail - The Contractor shall submit the construction and QA methodology, for each element of Landscape including, testing, inspection and hold points for review and approval prior to works.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Earthworks
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Class D geotextile fabric
Verifying Document - Data sheet, Delivery Docket
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Detail - Testing of on-site and imported topsoil for quality.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Topsoil must meet the criteria specified in the project standards.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section F
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once per source
Detail - Verify that the mulch used meets the specified criteria (e.g., pallet mulch, arborist mulch).
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Mulch material should be free of contaminants, sufficiently aged, and appropriate to site and slope conditions
Verifying Document - Data sheet, Delivery Docket
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 100% of mulch used
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - 450 GSM, 7mm thick, biodegradeable weed mat
Verifying Document - Data sheet, Delivery Docket
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Send seed mix to engineer for approval
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section F
Verifying Document - Data sheet, Delivery Docket
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Once prior to commencement of works
Detail - Required slope of 2h:1v, or follow the design drawings if they differ, regular inspections of the exposed soil.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Regular inspections
Detail - Confirm that the site has been marked out according to the project plans and specifications before construction begins.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall provide written notice to the Engineer, at least two days prior to Setting out.
Verifying Document - Setting Out Notice Report
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Before each stage
Detail - Grading for planting areas to ensure drainage.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Smooth, flowing contours with proper drainage.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G, PS 16.6.3
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 100% of areas
Detail - Excavation of tree pits according to specified dimensions.
PLANT SIZE (LITRE / PB) || NO. OF STAKES || TREE PIT SIZE
LESS THAN 15 LT / PB28 || 1 || 2X SIZE OF ROOT BALL
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Per tree pit
Detail - Correct staking and tree placement as per plan and specifications

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Newly planted specimen trees shall be staked with two 50 x 50 x 1.8m rough sawn Pine H4 treated or hardwood stakes with at least one third of their length (600mm) in the ground and at least 1.0m exposed minimum, or as specified on the plan with the approval of the Overseeing Organisation.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Tree
Detail - Timber stakes used for landscaping must be of specified type, treated to prevent decay, and meet size and quality requirements. 50mmx50mmx1500mm H4 Treated Pine Stakes
PLANT SIZE (LITRE / PB) || NO. OF STAKES || TREE PIT SIZE
LESS THAN 15 LT / PB28 || 1 || 2X SIZE OF ROOT BALL
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section I
Verifying Document - Delivery dockets, Checksheet, Photos
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Per order
Detail - All plantings shall have two-year slow-release fertilizer tablets installed at the time of planting.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Fertiliser tablet placed in bottom of hole before planting. Fertiliser composition: 6:15:3 (N:P:K). Up to 14l is 1 tab, 45l is 4 tabs
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - Correct mulch application on flat sites

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On sites flatter than a 1:3 grade (1.0m high by 3.0m metres long), mulch shall be spread evenly to a depth of 80-100mm after settlement, over the planted area, creating an inverted cone hollow around each plant stem with a maximum 25mm depth around plant stems.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On slopes steeper than 1:3 biodegradeable matting shall over lap 100mm between adjacent rolls and 500mm longitudinally
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On slopes steeper than 1:3 edges shall be keyed in to topsoil 150mm x 150mm
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On slopes steeper than 1:3 biodegradeable matting shall be pinned with frequency of 2 per m2 min.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - Apply grass seed as soon as practical after area is prepped. Protect newly established grass areas.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Newly established grass shall be protected from damage by pedestrian and vehicular traffic until grass has reached a self-sustaining state. Newly grassed areas shall be maintained with regular mowing (90mm-30mm) ensuring that all clippings are removed from adjacent hard surfaces.
Standard / Specification - NZTA P39: 2013, Section G
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each Area
Detail - As-Built records and drawings shall accurately record the layout and extents of all the work.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Record of work completed
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Earthworks
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.

name: SECTION 3 – PRE-CONSTRUCTION HOLD POINTS - MATERIALS, PERSONELL & THIRD PARTY APPROVALS

Detail - The Contractor shall submit the construction and QA methodology, for each element of Earthworks, incl construction, Site Access, dewatering, wet weather, testing, inspection and hold points for review and approval prior to works.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Confirmation from Ecology that earthworks and sheet piling can proceed
Verifying Document - Email from Ecology NZ
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Confirm that Erosion and Sedimentation Controls bunds are in place
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - The Contractor shall submit the full details of the Class C non-woven geotextile fabric to the Engineer for approval prior to installation.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Results to Engineer for Approval
Detail - The Contractor shall submit the full details of the Duraflow Draininage fabric to the Engineer for approval prior to installation.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Results to Engineer for Approval
3.6 - Crushing Resistance: Drainage aggregare /Structural fill - Used in subsoil fill
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.10 - The Crushing Resistance of Coarse Aggregate Under a Specified Load
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 2 Tests Per Material, Per Source
○ Results to Engineer 2 wks before importing
3.7 - Partical size distribution: Drainage aggregate/ structural fill - used in subsoil fill
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.8.1 - Particle Size Distribution
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Max Particle Size 53mm
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 Test per 100m3
3.8 - Weathering Resistance: Drainage aggregate / Structural fill - used in subsoil fill
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 3.11 - The Weathering Quality Index of Coarse Aggregate
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - CA or better
Standard / Specification - Appendix XVIII, PS 16.5.5, Appendix V
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 2 Tests Per Material, Per Source
○ Results to Engineer 2 wks before importing
Detail - Magnum Stone blocks are to be supplied by an approved supplier.
Verifying Document - Supplier to provide QA Documents, Visual Inspection
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Shall be 110mm diameter NZTA F/2 compliant smooth bore perforated pipe with filter sock
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to construction
Detail - Concrete strength shall be min. 17.5MPa
Standard / Specification - A s per Drawing (232735.02-WSP-DR-UDL-0407)
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) -
Detail - Engineer to inspect all foundation surface inspections
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Across stripped area
4.2 - Cut Subgrade Testing - Cohesive Soil, Shear Vane
Detail - NZ Geotechncial Society 2001 - Guideline for Hand Held Shear Vane Test
○ This test shall be undertaken at the design subgrade level to a depth of 2-3m below the design subgrade level
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Average Minimum SU:
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 0.5m interval, 4 test per 400M2
4.3 - Cut Subgrade - Import Structural fill, Release of Hold Point

Detail - To release the subgrade hold point and be able to start placing the Magnum Stone Blocks, the Contractor shall provide written certification that all inspected and tested subgrade complies with the requirements in PS 16.6
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Engineers Approval
Detail - The Contractor shall construct a 150 mm thick levelling pad on top of the subgrade using AP40 to accept the Magnum Stone Block wall.
○ Aggregate to be placed on geotextile filter fabric
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Prior to Magnum Stone Block installation
Detail - Blocks to be installed to the height and location as detailed on the construction drawings. The table below details acceptable tollerances
Element || Vertical Position || Horizontal Position || Vertical Alignment || Horizontal Alignment
Facings and wall structures || ±50mm || ±50mm || ±20mm in 30m || ±20mm in 3m
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each layer
Detail - A 110mm Drainage pipe wrapped in filter sock is to be installed along the internal perimeter of the blocks.
○ Core through Magnum Stone blocks at 10m c/c, install PVC subsoil outlet.
○ Internal block void hardfill to be 20/40 drainage aggregate or similar approved by engineer.
Standard / Specification - PS 16.5.8, PS 16.6.10, PS 17.6.3, TNZ F/6
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - No less than 24 hours prior to placement of backfill
Detail - Side-to-side overlap: Ensure at least a minimum of 500mm overlap between adjacent rolls and at any joins.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Insallation
Detail - All backfill is to be installed in 300mm lifts and tested as below
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - Each layer
Detail - ASTM D5874-16:2016 Clegg Hammer Testing
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 set (5 tests per 5x5m grid) per 1000m2 of placed per area worked each day, per lift
Detail - NZS4407:2015, Test 4.3 Nuclear Moisture Density Gauge (Backscatter Mode)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ave >95% of MDD
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - 1 set (5 tests) per 400mm lift (every 2nd lift) of fill per 1000m2 of placed

Detail - As-Built records and drawings shall accurately record the layout and extents of all the work including all of the cuts and fills, monitoring instrumentation, ground improvements, and locations of foundation / subsurface drainage systems and their outlets.
Testing Quantity Required (based from schedule qtys) - During Earthworks
